sn36.4:1.1: “Mendicants, when an unlearned ordinary person says that
sn36.4:1.2: there’s a hellish abyss under the ocean,
sn36.4:1.3: they’re speaking of something that doesn’t exist.
sn36.4:1.5: ‘Hellish abyss’ is a term for painful physical feelings.
sn36.4:1.6: When an unlearned ordinary person experiences painful physical feelings they sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
sn36.4:1.7: They’re called an unlearned ordinary person who hasn’t stood up in the hellish abyss and has gained no footing.
sn36.4:1.8: When a learned noble disciple experiences painful physical feelings they don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
sn36.4:1.9: They’re called a learned noble disciple who has stood up in the hellish abyss and gained a footing.
